Package org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.slice

Class SliceVW

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.slice.SliceVW
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Slice
public class SliceVW
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
A decorated slice is a sequence of pairs (Q0, b0)(Q1, b1)...(Qn, bn) where Qi is a set of states, bi is in {0, *, 1} indicating whether the corresponding vertex is guessed to belong to the skeleton (1), is being checked to be a non-skeleton vertex (0), or is put on hold(*). We call a (Qi, bi) a slice element in our implementation. This class is used for the preliminary version of the slice-based construction [Moshe Y. Vardi and Thomas Wilke. Automata: from logics to algorithms. In Logic and Automata: History and Perspective, volume 2 of Texts in Logic and Games, pages 629-736. Amsterdam University Press, 2007].
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SliceVW​(FSA source_automaton)
    Constructor with the slice automaton that this slice belongs to and the source NBW to be complemented.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    SliceVW clone()  
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)  
    StateSet getAllStates()
    Returns all states in this slice.
    java.util.List<SliceElement> getSliceElements()
    Returns the list of slice elements in this slice.
    FSA getSourceAutomaton()
    Returns the source NBW to be complemented.
    int hashCode()  
    boolean isAcceptingSlice()
    Returns true if this slice ((Q0,b0)(Q1,b1)...(Qn,bn), c) is an accepting slice, that is, there exists i such that bi = 1 and Qn is a subset of F (the acceptance set of the source NBW to be complemented).
    boolean isDecorated()
    Returns true if the decoration of every slice element in this slice has been initialized as Zero, One, or Star.
    boolean isResetSlice()
    Returns true if this slice ((Q0,b0)(Q1,b1)...(Qn,bn), c) is a reset slice, that is, for all i, bi != 0.
    java.lang.String toString()
